Test mit Wert 0 [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

Zero tolerance, for `true` answer test

Report deviation in percent

fb_unit(1.1*m, stackunits(1.11, m),0) #{@fb_unit(1.1*m, stackunits(1.11, m),0)@}#

**Non-zero tolerance**, for `false` answer test

fb_unit(1.1*m, 0*m,0.005)
#{@fb_unit(1.1*m, 0*m,0.005)@}#

fb_unit(1.1*m, stackunits(0,m),0.005) #{@fb_unit(1.1*m, stackunits(0,m),0.005)@}#

the same with zero input

fb_unit(0*m, stackunits(0,m),0.005) #{@fb_unit(0*m, stackunits(0,m),0.005)@}#

Zero input with no unit

fb_unit(0, stackunits(zero, m),0.005) #{@fb_unit(0, stackunits(zero, m),0.005)@}#

Zero input with unit factor (doesn't work)

fb_unit(0*m, stackunits(zero, m),0.005) #{@fb_unit(0*m, stackunits(zero, m),0.005)@}#

nonzero input with correct unit

fb_unit(1*m, stackunits(zero, m),0.005) #{@fb_unit(1*m, stackunits(zero, m),0.005)@}#

Zero sans, nonzero tans

fb_unit(0*m, stackunits(1, m),0.005) #{@fb_unit(0*m, stackunits(1, m),0.005)@}#

test for sign feedback

fb_unit(-1.1*m, stackunits(1.11, m),0.005) #{@fb_unit(-1.1*m, stackunits(1.11, m),0.005)@}#

Deviation less than tolerance

fb_unit(1.1*m, stackunits(1.101, m),0.005) #{@fb_unit(1.1*m, stackunits(1.101, m),0.005)@}#

Mantissa correct, order of magnitude not correct

fb_unit(1.1*m, stackunits(11, m),0.005) #{@fb_unit(1.1*m, stackunits(11, m),0.005)@}#

Value too small

fb_unit(1.0*m, stackunits(11, m),0.005) #{@fb_unit(1.0*m, stackunits(11, m),0.005)@}#

Value too big

fb_unit(100*m, stackunits(11, m),0.005) #{@fb_unit(100*m, stackunits(11, m),0.005)@}#
